page.title: 09Activities within Church
page.content: In addition to the regular church services Cotton End Baptist Church is actively engaged in encouraging community spirit. There is a mid-week club for games and Bible reading which has an attendance of between 25 and 30 five to ten year olds. During the summer holidays the childrens club has a four day holiday programme. Occasionally, after Church on Sunday, a "frugal meal" is enjoyed. Participants eat soup, bread and cheese and contribute a sum of money to the "tear fund". For the teenagers there is a musical workshop and a variety of evening functions, like the Italian evening soon to be enjoyed. At Christmas members of the Church carol sing, not specifically to raise money, but as a celebration of this festival. The Church Hall is used by playgoup and mothers and toddlers.
